name: Line Up In Alphabetical Order! Multiple Choice Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: I just received a new box of Crayola crayons. The excitement is killing me so I open the box and find the crayons in alphabetical order. The first crayon I pull out of the box is the color of a nut. I take a look at the name and find the crayon color is called what?
questions.explanation:
Almond.

	Crayola added the color almond to its 120 pack of crayons in 1998.

questions.text: The next color in the Crayola crayon box is named after something girls do when a boy says something nice to them. What color is it?
questions.explanation:
Blush.

	Before being renamed Blush in 2000, the crayon was known as Cranberry. Blush can be found in the box set of 120 Crayola crayons.

questions.text: The next crayon I pulled out of the box was the color of the sweet I can get at the fair or circus. What Crayola crayon is it?
questions.explanation:
Cotton Candy.

	Cotton candy is a light pink crayon. The color only comes in the box of 120 crayons. This crayon color was issued in 1998.

questions.text: I'm loving coloring with my new crayons, but I'm getting ready to color a beach scene. What color Crayola crayon could I use to make sand?
questions.explanation:
Desert.

	Desert Sand was issued in 1998 for the 120 box set of crayons.

questions.text: After my ocean picture, I started working on a vegetable picture. I was coloring this for my grandmother and her favorite vegetable is purple and just happened to be the name of this crayon. What Crayola crayon did I choose for this vegetable?
questions.explanation:
Eggplant.

	Eggplant is a purple Crayola crayon that was issued for the 120 box of crayons in 1998.

questions.text: I want the background of my vegetable picture to be the woods. I have the color brown for the trunk of the tree, but I need a good color for the leaves of my tree. What Crayola crayon would be good for tree leaves?
questions.explanation:
Forest Green.

	Forest Green was a Crayola crayon issued in 1958. The crayon comes in the box of 64 crayons.

questions.text: My mom thought since I colored a vegetable picture I should color a fruit picture for my grandfather. His favorite apple just happens to be a color of a Crayola crayon. What color should I use to color the apple?
questions.explanation:
Granny Smith.

	Granny Smith is a green crayon issued in 1993 for the box of 96 crayons.

questions.text: When I was searching through the Crayola crayons to find a color for my fruit picture, I only found one starting with the letter 'H'. This color would never fit into my fruit picture because the crayon color was Hot Magenta, which is fluorescent.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Hot Magenta is a florescent pink crayon that was issued in 1972 for the box of 72 crayons.

questions.text: For my grandfather's fruit picture, I want to add a worm in the apple. I find a Crayola crayon called Inchworm. What color is the Inchworm crayon?
questions.explanation:
Green.

	The Inchworm crayon was issued in 2003 for the box of 120 crayons.

questions.text: When I took the pictures to my grandma and grandpa, my grandma was making jam in her kitchen. I quickly took out a piece of paper and my crayons to color a picture of her. For the jam, what color Crayola crayon did I use?
questions.explanation:
Jazzberry Jam.

	Jazzleberry Jam is a red crayon issued in 2003 for the box of 120 crayons.
